author: mrmitch
title: Snowmobile in the Artic
review: The Artic theme was one of the first ones I started my collection with, so they hold a special place in my LEGO heart. This is a inexpensive set costing less than $2.00 US dollars. I have a few other Artic sets and this is a nice addition to them. If you get into Artic good cheap set to add to the team.

author: omgbrick
title: Snow scooter
review: I got this for only two dollars cheap its a good set the snow scotter looks good but let me point outthe main body of it (the orange part is just one piece. the minifig looks nice. it comes with two skis and two chainsaws for the back treads. my only complait would be that it should have come with snow shoes or an ice ax. 4/5

author: Odeinoichus
title: It's Cold Up There
review:
Set #6626 Snow Scooter: Arctic, LEGO Town's version of the ice sub-theme we'd seen it before in LEGO Space with Ice Planet 2002, but this time we're given an icy sub-theme in a more realistic setting.

 

LEGO Arctic sets introduced us to a wonderful new animal piece, the LEGO Polar Bear, I think LEGO should bring that piece back in a special new set or even just re-release one of the larger Arctic sets as a new Legends set.

 

The Snow Scooter isn't much to talk about, it featured a small number of pieces in its build and one Mini-Figure with parka, but it was still a fun set. Alone though it isn't much, but if you included it with other Arctic sets you'd have a lot more fun than just this set alone. Although this was a cheap way to get some snow scooters and parkas to give to other LEGO Mini-Figures in your collection so you could start making a winter scene. If you can find a few of these for a good price I think they'd enhance any winter displays or even christmas ones.
